Dispute_Type: Alleged discrimination in medical care during incarceration
Legal_Issue: Whether the Canadian Human Rights Commission erred in dismissing the complaint for lack of a prohibited ground of discrimination
Evidence_Assessment: Insufficient evidence linking treatment to race or disability-based discrimination
Burden_of_Proof: On claimant to establish a prohibited ground of discrimination
Legal_Rule: Under s. 41(1)(c) of the Canadian Human Rights Act, the Commission may refuse complaints not based on prohibited grounds
Procedural_Issue: Commission's discretion to dismiss complaints lacking prohibited grounds
Outcome_on_Merits: No violation found due to insufficient evidence
Key_Evidence_Considered: Allegations of inadequate medical care, lack of evidentiary link to discrimination
Legal_Rule_Source: s. 41(1)(c) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Authority: Canadian Human Rights Commission, Federal Court
Legal_Provision_Cited: s. 41(1)(c) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Lack of prohibited ground under the Act
Applicable_Process: Complaint review and dismissal by Commission, followed by judicial review
Governing_Rule: s. 41(1)(c) of the Canadian Human Rights Act
